key_points: During the Texas winter storm in mid-February, smugglers risked the lives of immigrants by continuing cross-border activities.
Border patrol agents rescued over 200 immigrants and found four deceased due to the winter freeze.
A woman was reported 'left for dead' by her smuggler in the Big Bend Sector, Van Horn, Texas, on February 13.
The woman survived nearly a week alone, hiding among rocks and in an abandoned shed to escape the cold.
A local rancher alerted CBP to the presence of the woman on his land.
Border patrol agents and emergency medical technicians treated the woman for hypothermia and severe frostbite.
The woman had to have her core body temperature elevated before she could be transported to a hospital.
Officials highlighted the dangers of placing trust in smugglers, who often abandon individuals unable to keep up.
The woman received 'extensive medical treatment' and was then returned to the agency for 'appropriate adjudication.'
She will likely be sent back to Mexico for illegally crossing the border.
